annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (37) In its decision initiating the formal investigation procedure laid down in Article 88(2) of the EC Treaty, the Commission provisionally classified the measures under examination as state aid within the meaning of Article 87(1) of the EC Treaty and Article 61(1) of the EEA Agreement because they were granted through state resources and because, by improving the recipient's financial position, they were likely to affect the economic position of competitors from other Member States (¹5) and consequently distorted or threatened to distort competition and affected trade between Member States.
annotations.translation: (37) 委员会在启动《欧共体条约》第 88(2) 条规定的正式调查程序的决定中，根据《欧共体条约》第 87(1) 条和《欧共体协定》第 61(1) 条的含义，暂时将正在审议的措施归类为国家援助，因为这些措施是通过国家资源提供的，而且由于改善接受国的财政状况，这些措施可能影响其他成员国竞争者的经济地位 (¹5)，从而扭曲或有可能扭曲竞争，并影响成员国之间的贸易。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (38) On the basis of its provisional assessment, the Commission concluded that the aid had to be assessed in the light of the Community guidelines on state aid for rescuing and restructuring firms in difficulty (the guidelines ') (¹6) and that there were no other provisions of the Treaty or other Community guidelines that might render the aid compatible. It agreed with Germany that BGB was a firm in difficulty within the meaning of paragraph 2.1 of the guidelines, but it seriously doubted whether the aid measures were compatible with the common market.
annotations.translation: (38) 在临时评估的基础上，委员会得出结论认为，必须根据欧共体关于挽救和重组陷入困境的公司的国家援助指南（”指南“）(¹6) 来评估援助，《条约》或欧共体其他指南中没有其他规定可能使援助与之相容。 委员会同意德国的意见，即 BGB 是指南第 2.1 段所指的陷入困境的公司，但委员会对援助措施是否与共同市场相容持严重疑虑态度。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (39) Paragraphs 31 to 34 of the guidelines state that, in the case of all individual aid measures, the Commission will examine the restructuring plan to establish whether it is capable of restoring the long-term viability of the firm within a reasonable timescale and on the basis of reasonable assumptions.
annotations.translation: (39) 指南第 31 至 34 段规定，对于所有个别援助措施，委员会将审查重组计划，以确定该计划是否能够在合理的时间内，以及基于合理的假设，恢复公司的长期生存能力。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (40) The Commission took the view that in the restructuring plan initially submitted there was no explanation of future strategies on the market in investment banking. As regards future strategy in the real estate business, it wanted to see more detailed specification of the difference in costs between liquidation and continued operation of the real estate services subsidiary IBAG.
annotations.translation: (40) 委员会认为，在最初提交的重组计划中，没有解释投资银行市场的未来策略。关于房地产业务的未来战略，委员会希望看到房地产服务子公司 IBAG 的清算和持续运营之间成本差异的更详细说明。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (41) The Commission doubted whether the market assumptions in the initial restructuring plan and the forecasts of supply and demand were sufficiently precise to allow conclusions to be drawn regarding the prospects of success of the restructuring measures proposed. It was difficult to see on what market assumptions the restructuring measures were based.
annotations.translation: (41) 委员会对初始重组计划中的市场假设以及供需预测是否足够准确，足以得出有关拟议重组措施的成功前景的结论持有疑虑。很难看出重组措施是基于哪些市场假设。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (42) The Commission also found that the information supplied by Germany with regard to the causes of the firm's difficulties in the past was relatively superficial. The following three causes were cited: (a) bad loans; (b) the issue of extensive guarantees for real estate funds; and (c) the late introduction (1999) and slow implementation of systematic risk control. The information supplied was essentially a summary of the financial difficulties. Only one real reason for these difficulties was put forward, namely ineffective group and management structures, including the lack of an effective system of risk control. There was no in-depth analysis of these structures or of specific management shortcomings, such as the implications of state ownership. However, the Commission took the view that an analysis of this kind was necessary if there was to be a proper assessment of the prospects for the restructured BGB. It doubted therefore whether the causes of BGB's difficulties were properly identified and addressed in the restructuring plan. It thus asked Germany to provide an in-depth analysis of past shortcomings and of future prospects and problems, in the context of group structures, management and supervisory methods, control and reporting patterns and techniques for the introduction of commercially based decision-making processes.
annotations.translation: (42) 委员会还发现，德国提供的关于公司过去困难原因的信息相对肤浅。 委员会列举了以下三个原因：(a) 不良贷款； (b) 为房地产资金提供大量担保的问题； (c) 较晚引入系统风险控制（ 1999年）且实施缓慢。 所提供的信息基本上是对财务困难的总结。 造成这些困难的真正原因只有一个，即缺乏有效的集团和管理结构，包括缺乏有效的风险控制系统。对这些结构或具体的管理缺陷，例如国家所有权的影响，没有进行深入分析。 然而，委员会认为，如果要对重组后的 BGB 的前景进行适当评估，就必须进行此类分析。 因此，委员会对 BGB 的困难原因是否在重组计划中得到适当的识别和解决持有疑虑。 因此，委员会要求德国在集团结构、管理和监督方法、控制和报告模式以及引入基于商业决策过程的技术等方面，对过去的缺点以及未来的前景和问题进行深入分析。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (43) Germany spoke of negotiations with potential buyers with a view to a possible privatisation but gave no details of the procedures envisaged, the terms of sale or other relevant factors. The Commission therefore wondered whether privatisation, in whole or in part, was being seriously considered and whether, if privatisation did take place, it would be conducted by means of an open, transparent and non-discriminatory procedure.
annotations.translation: (43) 德国谈到与潜在买家进行谈判，以期实现可能的私有化，但没有详细说明设想的程序、销售条款或其他相关因素。因此，委员会想知道，是否正在认真考虑全部或部分私有化，以及如果确实进行私有化，是否将通过公开、透明和非歧视性的程序进行。
